'''Religious intolerance''' is [[intolerance]] motivated by one's own religious beliefs, generally against another's religious beliefs. Religious intolerance and [[persecution]] have been common throughout history, and most [[faith]]s have been subject to it at one time or another.
See: *[[Anti-Semitism]] *[[Anti-Mormonism]] *[[Anti-Catholicism]] *[[Crusades]] *[[Holocaust]] *[[Islamophobia]] *[[Jihad]] *[[Persecution of Christians]] *[[Persecution of Hindus]] *[[Persecution of Muslims]] *[[Persecution of Sikhs]] *[[Terrorism]]
The opposite of intolerance is [[religious pluralism]].
